para.text: An electrologist shall include one of the following qualifications in an advertisement:
Licensed by the Board of Nursing — Electrology Practice Committee.
An electrologist shall include in any advertising the name and address of at least one licensed electrologist or licensed electrology instructor practicing at the location advertised.

An electrologist may not, on behalf of the electrologist, a partner, an associate, or electrology affiliate, use or participate in the use of any form of public communication which contains a deceptive or misleading statement or claim. A deceptive or misleading statement or claim is one that:
That the electrologist is a certified or recognized specialist other than as licensed by the Board, unless the statement is true;
That the electrologist has superior education or credentials that are different than any other licensed electrologist or licensed electrologist instructor, if they are not;
An unwarranted claim of superior service;
A material misrepresentation of fact or presentation of fact that is likely to cause an ordinary prudent individual to misunderstand or to be deceived; or
An unreasonable claim likely to create unjustified expectations; or
Fails to include any fact necessary to make a statement not misleading.
An electrologist may not use electronic media, including telephone, radio, internet, and motion pictures, in a manner that is unreasonable, misleading, or fraudulent.

section.heading: Other Licenses.
section.text: Electrologists or electrology instructors advertising other services for which they are licensed within one advertisement shall:

para.text: Clearly state each service offered under each license.

section.heading: Fees.
section.text: A statement regarding fees shall be considered deceptive or misleading if the electrologist:

para.text: Charges more than the fee advertised for a service rendered; or
Fails to offer the service at the fee advertised for a reasonable period of time after the advertisement unless a specific time limit is included in the original advertisement.

section.heading: Responsibility.
section.text: An electrologist shall be responsible for an advertisement of service regardless of whether the advertising has been generated by the electrologist personally, by an employee, or by a proprietorship, partnership, corporation, union, clinic or institution, which uses the electrologist's services.

section.heading: Penalties.
section.text: Violation of this chapter is a violation of Health Occupations Article, §§8-6B-23 and 8-6B-18(a)(10), Annotated Code of Maryland, and may result in disciplinary action pursuant to Health Occupations Article, §8-6B-18, Annotated Code of Maryland.
